title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: very smooth and detailed oriented. interviewer was patient and understanding. shares a lot of knowledge. open to suggestions and also feedback. very open to the next stage of the process. did not get the job though. but they still gave recommendations on other job prospects.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Advertising Account Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: First was a group interview. Then if you make a good impression you move on to the one on one interview. It’s a friendly environment and your up against other GBC candidates
Interview Questions: Do you enjoy sales and speaking to people?

title: Part Time Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly informal and consisted mostly of an overview of expectations, classroom teaching format, and very basic tips on time management within lecture slots. Time was allotted for the interviewee to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us a bit about yourself.

title: Fashion Field Education Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of 4 individuals, a mixture of professors and human resources. The questions were asked and I was given time to consider my answer before providing it to them. Overall, it was an intimidating process and I felt a bit unprepared unfortunately. I had actually written an entire list of possible questions and prepared beforehand but a mixture of nerves got the better of the situation. If you are preparing for this interview, review situational questions, what would you do if X? or how would you do Y? It's a bit difficult to do without context but it would be help build confidence going into the meeting.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had arranged for a speaker to come present for the students and no students showed up?

title: Human Rights Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was well organized but did feel rushed at times. It was difficult to complete a presentation and interview questions within the one- hour time frame. However, beyond that, the interview went well.
Interview Questions: They asked behavioural and situational based questions.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Brown College in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Very friendly. And good at describing daily responsibilities. There were three people in the panel and every one was good technically.
Interview process was smooth and right on point.
They gave enough time for me to answer completely and were very oatient althrough.
Interview Questions: What difficulty have you faced with prev project and how did you resolve

title: Industry & Events Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: It's a pretty formal process with a variety standard interview questions, behavioral questions and scenario questions. The job description is a huge indicator for the type of questions they will ask. Make sure to read it thoroughly!
Interview Questions: How does your education and previous experience make you an ideal candidate?

title: Lab Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: A very relaxing and laid-back experience, they were on time with the interview appointment. They were more focused on what type of person you are. Make sure when you go for the interview to understand the exam or test process in any college or university.
Interview Questions: If you were to encounter individual cheating how are you to approach the situation.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview first to share the education and working experience. Need to do 2 math tests and each of them will take less than 30 mins. Easy tests and very friendly interviewers.
Interview Questions: Behavior question: Pretend as a student and ask you to teach for one math question.

title: Notetaker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: We were asked to bring our own laptops as there was an exam to check how fast, efficient and accurate you type.  A then after, you will be taken to a separate room to have an interview. Be prepared to answer questions related to your experience, background and interest in the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position?

title: Community Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Video interview where we had to upload videos based on the questions sent and then zoom interview in which was pretty standard. I had some internet issues with the online video interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be in the role, what does community care look like for you, what is your experience working with students

title: Financial Aid Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: Nice and simple. Went in person for interview at Casa Loma. Panel interview with HR. Asked general interview questions including behavioural. Pleasant experience overall with the manager, and hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why do you want to work with us.

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: One round of interviews.. questions related to teamwork and problem solving.. written test for communication skills. Panel of 3. Could feel the tension between the interviewers ironic because a lot of questions were about conflict and being a team player. Not much eye contact almost avoiding all connections.
Interview Questions: How would you face conflict

title: Shop Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty much i applied for the job through GBC job portal within two to three days i got a reply to com ein for a job interview which was online.
Interview Questions: What do i see myself doing in five years?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was just a one-step interview. The interviewer asked a couple of questions mainly regarding my previous experience and how that would fit into the current role. Nothing overly difficult, very welcoming.
Interview Questions: What makes a good teacher?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: the teacher will refer you to the project, please prepare cv or resume and your portfolio. Each project term is different, you need to contact the project manager or related teacher to know more about the project details.
Interview Questions: no interview questions, just need cv or resume

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Brown College in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick phone screen and the Recruiter mentioned that they would follow up but never did. Did disclose that they would move me to the next step but never heard back!
Interview Questions: Behaviour and culture fit questions

title: Design Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: you just met the manager and she will ask about your experience and just ask questions to get to know you as a person. And it was simply just one round.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Brown College (Casa Loma, ON) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I saw the job posting in the board inside our library and applied in person and dropped my CV. Later I got an interview offer via email. It was a one to one interview. My supervisor interviewed me in the Library herself. She asked about my experience, personal and professional life. Then threw some problems that I might face in the library and how I would deal with each one. I felt comfortable and confident in answering her.
Interview Questions: How am I going to deal with difficult/angry students

title: Community Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 interviews conducted, one with the immediate supervisor, and one with the manager. They contacted me after 2 weeks of applying.  Fast and quick application process. Panel interview was intimidating but they were very kind. They hire a lot of people with  social service backgrounds/ outreach activities.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stressful situations

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: HR sends a question for you to prepare a presentation. It requires a lot of preparation. A series of interview questions and a presentation. The presentation was difficult as you have present in front of a large panel.
Interview Questions: What have you done to contribute to the community locally.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel of 6, all with a list of pre-written questions.  Each asked two and went around the table.  I also had to prepare a presentation.
Interview Questions:
mistake you've made?
tactics you use to build relationships/sell?

title: Student Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Judged on curiosity and competence for the role Good conversation about the role Described deeper about the opportunity for employment. Whether other colleagues were students as well, how their schedule worked around their school schedule
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you

title: Lab Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I already was on friendly terms with the hiring manager.  The process was very informal.  I stated I was interested in the Lab Monitor position and I was hired almost immediately.
Interview Questions: When can you start the position?

title: Peer Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: I applied via school's website and they contacted me within a month. I was having a group interview. Interviewers were having lots of questions about your personalities and then we had some group activities as well
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Student Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: I met with a panel, there was a brief 10 minute presentation, as well as the standard behavioural questions, went for 30-35 minutes... the questions were asked by all panel members
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through GBC website internally, the process took about 1 or 2 days for me to get an in-person interview. The interview was pretty short and brief.
Interview Questions: How's your experience with dealing student from a different cultural background?

title: Computerized Notetaker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: There was a skills test before the interview.  Once done, I was taken to another room for the interview process. It was a one on one interview, quiet difficult at the start but as it progressed I became comfortable. Small talk first then in comes the typical HR questions where you have to think about a situation, action and result.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position?

title: Food Bank Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview done with a few candidates and three board members in one room. Questions were straightforward based on your previous experiences and how they could help you in this job. There were also some scenario based questions
Interview Questions: How can you assure that clients are served properly at the food bank?

title: Information Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: Short interview, general questions. It was informal meeting with the manager (no HR) - managers hire part-time employees directly. Manager explained the job and asked "tell me about yourself (education, work experience). It was more like a conversation than an interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Describe a project of your choice, why you did this opt for this project, what was the outcome of this project. The interview was in a quite good environment, no rush from the manager, it lasted for more than an hour.
Interview Questions: why you chose this project?

title: Student Success Advisor/Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was friendly and professional. I was interviewed by a panel of two people. Managers in the department. There was only one in-person interview which was held at the St. James campus.
Interview Questions: How would you support students from diverse background and ensure inclusivity?

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a friendly process, overall.  Small talk first, then go through the set questions. Most questions were behavior based , targeting your problem solving skills, team building skills, time management skills and so on. The interviewer asked for some details regarding my previous work but not that much. There was also questions related to how to serve students with disability. The interview lasted less than half an hour. Then the interviewer provided more details about what the next process would be, and confirmed my contact information, and advised me how to prepare for the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are good for this job?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a panel of two  and it went on for an hour - 20 mins interview 20 mins test. The questions asked were structured and were set of 10-12 questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you worked with a difficult team member.

title: College Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
2 interviews. 
Phone and Face to Face
Very intense, the interviewer called at around 4:30pm and without asking if I am ready to give an phone interview started asking question. How I was screen I dont know. 
The Face to face interview was a set of standard HR question but very intense.
Interview Questions:
Strength and weakness question.
Conflict resolving question

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: They contacted you over email through the co-op office asking you to come into a panel interview with 4 of the marketing managers, once each manager asked you their set of questions they asked if you had any questions for them. The interview was Tuesday and I had received an offer by Thursday.
Interview Questions:
What do you love about George Brown College?
What is something you don't like about George Brown College?

title: Service Provision Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume through procedures listed on employment page. The interview itself was normal. I was supposed to do an Excel test but they forgot. Realistically GBC is a very disorganized place so this is not too suprising. I was not offered the role I applied for but one very similar.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience when you had to give customer service in a difficult situation

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It went really well. The interviewer was very sweet and professional. It was a very comfortable environment and I had no trouble answering the questions. Very relevant questions. I had to go through two interviews before my offer with GBC.
Interview Questions: What makes you a great fit for the role?

title: Database Support (Work Study Program) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the Database Support Manager and she just asked me general questions and the program that I was taking with the school.  She was nice and accommodating with regards to scheduling and starting.  She gave me a brief description of what they are doing and what is going to be my function in the process.
Interview Questions: General Questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First interview was on phone. Recruiters asked about soft skills and my previous work experience.
Second interview was in person at college with 3 people in panel. One recruiter, the project manager and the supervisor. It took about 30 minutes and they asked different technical and soft-skill related questions.
Interview Questions:
First round questions were mostly about my soft skills like time management, handling work load.
The second round involved technical questions about the project.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Find the posting on school's website so I applied online and get reference from my professor. After two week of process I get the interview opportunity. I interview with the manager for nearly 30 mins . I get the offer after 5 days.
Interview Questions: What's your strength? How to control  error in work?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was concrete and polite. The reference letter and awards seem to be really important also the people that you already know in the college could make a big difference
Interview Questions: Main authors in your discipline

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Brown College
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for a Front Desk Assistant (summer position). The interview was composed by approximately 15 behavioural questions (what would you do in a given situation) to test problem solving and handling conflicts skills and a simple small test (writing an email to a student) to test communication skills.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me about a situation where you had to solve a difficult problem.
- When have you had to deal with an irate customer?

title: Supervisor of Digital Media Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by email to tell me of the panel interview. Given a couple of tasks to prepare for the interview. Had a first interview by a group committee. Second interview was a two person interview with direct line manager and another manager that the successful candidate would work with. Im awaiting a job offer or not.
Interview Questions:
SWOT Analysis of Website and behavioural questions. 
20 Interview questions over 1 hour period. 
10 Minute presentation on SWOT Analysis

title: Health Information Management Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process consisted of one on one interviews with the candidates with the Coordinator of the Health Information Management Department.  She asked a series of questions that dealt with past education, work history, as well as more focused questions on why you wanted to work at GBC and what lead you to a career in HIM.
Interview Questions: Describe a previous job that you've had?

title: Events and Projects Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submit my application through the George Brown web portal, and was invited for an interview with the department manager. I was successful in the interview, and began a 4 month contract which was extended for another 4 months. I finished my contract after working at the College for 8 months, and was happy with my time there.
Interview Questions: What had I done that I felt prepared me for the position at the College.

title: Student Advisor At Library Learning Common Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
- Introduce myself
- General knowledge question about the organization
- Questions that I have for the organization

The employor did not lead the flow of the interview seriously. As an international students, I was able to manage myself to answer for questions as confident as possible. However, for the last step to ask a question about the organization, it could have been challenege, if I would not had have studied and observed the difference in the library.
Interview Questions: What kinds of the previous experience would lead you to become a successful candidate for this position?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by Project Lead and Project Manager. It was good  experience as it was interview for the internship. There were 5 candidates in the room . We got questions and we answered on those one by one .
Interview Questions: Specific questions related to business analysis (requirements gathering)

title: Student BIM Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with Project Managers/Recruiters from Research department.Upon completion of interview was selected to help assist in research for a particular project with industry partner. The department itself is constantly looking for students to help research on various projects industry partners are looked to further investigate and test prior to implementation in their company.
Interview Questions: What are some of the technical skills you can apply as a BIM researcher.

title: Computerized Note Taker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: They call you for an interview and when you get there, there are about 20 people in the room of all applicants. They tell you what they want you to do which is to take notes from a ted talk. You sit there and take notes from a ted talk. It is a very long and tedious process
Interview Questions: Are you effective at taking notes?

title: User Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: A Panel of Supervisors and Managers each ask you a question; be prepared for situational questions, better to err on the side of dressing too officially; they may ask you if you are nervous at the time of the interview
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Operations Coordinator, Hospitality Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Brown College (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: 3 panel structured interview, situation questions with questions at the end
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you faced difficulty working in a team setting, how did you resolve it, and what were the outcomes.
